meanings.definition: Having more characteristics of an oak tree.
meanings.sent1: The old chair looked oakier after it was polished.
meanings.sent2: The new table was oakier than the one we had before.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel found an oakier spot to hide its acorns.
meanings.sent4: Her voice sounded oakier as she sang under the ancient oak tree.
meanings.sent5: The smell of the forest was oakier than anything she had ever experienced.

meanings.sent1: The wine tasted oakier than the one we had last night.
meanings.sent2: The wood in the cabin was oakier than in the barn.
meanings.sent3: The joke got oakier as he tried to make it funnier.
meanings.sent4: His laughter echoed through the oakier room, filling it with joy.
meanings.sent5: The sky turned oakier as the sun set behind the hills.
